neuron

Class NeuronCollectionFixedFrequency

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.amd.aparapi.Kernel
      • base.ComponentCollection
        • base.ConfigurableComponentCollection<C>
          • neuron.NeuronCollection<NeuronConfigurationFixedFrequency>
            • neuron.NeuronCollectionFixedFrequency
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ComponentConfigurationListener, java.lang.Cloneable

    public class NeuronCollectionFixedFrequency
extends NeuronCollection<NeuronConfigurationFixedFrequency>
    A collection of neurons that produce spikes at a fixed frequency. The frequency of spiking for each neuron is determined by its associated NeuronConfigurationFixedFrequency.
    Author:
    Oliver J. Coleman

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public void init()
        Description copied from class: ComponentCollection
        Initialise the collection. This method should be called from a sub-classes constructor. Sub-classes should override this method to set the values for pre-calculated values used during the simulation, and call this super-method. Arrays/buffers initialised here and used in the run() method/kernel should be transferred to the execution hardware using put().
        Overrides:
        init in class NeuronCollection<NeuronConfigurationFixedFrequency>

      • step

        public void step()
        Description copied from class: ComponentCollection
        Update the model over one time step. Sub-classes should call this super method. The step() method will invoke the overridden run() method which defines the Aparapi kernel.
        Overrides:
        step in class NeuronCollection<NeuronConfigurationFixedFrequency>
        See Also:
        NeuronCollection.step()
